Name: Commission of Animal Control and Welfare
Purpose: Holds hearings and makes recommendations to the city on animal-related issues.
City Affiliation: San Francisco Animal Care and Control (SFACC)

Name: Advisory Committee of Street Artists and Craftsmen Examiners
Purpose: Advises the Arts Commission on the certification of artists to sell their work in designated spaces, including street vending locations throughout San Francisco.

Name: City Hall Preservation Advisory Commission
Purpose: Advises the Mayor, Board of Supervisors, Planning Commission, and others on maintenance, operation, and preservation of City Hall.

Name: Cannabis Oversight Committee
Purpose: Advises the Board of Supervisors and Mayor on the implementation and enforcement of cannabis laws and regulations.

Name: Bayview Hunters Point Citizens Advisory Committee
Purpose: Advises the City on planning and land use policy for Zone 2 and Survey Area C of the Bayview Hunters Point Redevelopment Project Area.
City Affiliation: City Administrator, San Francisco Planning Department

Name: Citizens Committee on Community Development
Purpose: Makes recommendations to the Mayor and Board of Supervisors on HUD-based funding allocations and policy matters that are directly related to community development efforts in the city.
City Affiliation: Mayor's Office of Housing and Community Development (MOHCD)

Name: Market and Octavia Community Advisory Committee
Purpose: Advises the Planning department, Planning Commission, and Board of Supervisors, on the development of the Market and Octavia area.
Authorization: Planning Code § 341.5; Board of Supervisors Res. No. 474-08

Name: SOMA Community Stabilization Fund Community Advisory Committee
Purpose: Advises the Mayor's Office of Community Development, Board of Supervisors, and the Mayor on recommended expenditures of the SOMA community stabilization fund.
City Affiliation: Mayor's Office of Housing and Community Development (MOHCD)

Name: South of Market Community Planning Advisory Committee
Purpose: Advises city agencies regarding the implementation of the Central SoMa, East SoMa, and Western SoMa Area Plans.
City Affiliation: San Francisco Planning Department, multiple other agencies

Name: Southeast Community Facility Commission
Purpose: Advises the Public Utilities Commission about the operations of the PUC-managed Southeast Community Facility, including educational and job skills programs, child care, a senior activities center, budget matters, and proposed leases with qualified tenants.

Name: Community Corrections Partnership
Purpose: Advises the City on the use of evidence-based practices in sentencing and probation.
Appointed By: Multiple agencies dealing with criminal justice system

Name: Reentry Council
Purpose: Coordinates local efforts to support adults exiting the jail and prison system.
Appointed By: BoS, Mayor, DPH, HSA, multiple depts. dealing with criminal justice system and courts
City Affiliation: Multiple agencies dealing with probation, courts, law enforcement, human services

Name: Sentencing Commission
Purpose: Advises the Mayor and the Board of Supervisors on strategies to improve public safety, reduce recidivism, and reform criminal sentencing.
Appointed By: Multiple agencies dealing with criminal justice system
City Affiliation: Multiple agencies dealing with probation, courts, law enforcement, human services

Name: Committee on City Workforce Alignment
Purpose: Develops a Citywide Workforce Development Plan to coordinate workforce development services across city departments.
City Affiliation: Office of Economic and Workforce Development (OEWD)

Name: Treasure Island/Yerba Buena Island Citizens Advisory Board
Purpose: Provides additional as-requested expertise to the TIDA Board of Directors.

Name: Free City College Oversight Committee
Purpose: Advises the Board of Supervisors, relevant city departments, and City College on the use of funds from the Free City College Program.
City Affiliation: San Francisco Department of Children, Youth and their Families (DCYF)

Name: Ballot Simplification Committee
Purpose: Writes summaries of local ballot measures and assists the Director of Elections in preparing San Francisco's Voter Information Pamphlet.

Name: Municipal Green Building Task Force
Purpose: Advises the city on green building issues and the integration of green building practices into city departments.

Name: Urban Forestry Council
Purpose: Develops an urban forest plan and tree care standards and facilitates tree management responsibilities among agencies.

Name: State Legislation Committee
Purpose: Recommends endorsement, opposition, or neutrality on proposed state legislation that affects the interests of San Francisco.
Appointed By: Mayor, BoS, Controller, Assessor, City Attorney

Name: Sunshine Ordinance Task Force
Purpose: Advises the Board of Supervisors, city departments, and commissions on the implementation of the Sunshine Ordinance and ensures deliberations of city agencies are conducted in public view.

Name: Treasury Oversight Committee
Purpose: Oversees the city's surplus funds and investments.
City Affiliation: Office of the Treasurer & Tax Collector

Name: Local Homeless Coordinating Board
Purpose: Works to ensure a unified Continuum of Care strategy that is supported by city officials, nonprofit agencies, and homeless people.
City Affiliation: Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing (HSH)

Name: Our City Our Home Oversight Committee
Purpose: Advises the Mayor and Board of Supervisors on the allocation of the Our City, Our Home fund, directed at homelessness and financed by Proposition C, the Homelessness Gross Receipts Tax Ordinance.
City Affiliation: Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing (HSH)

Name: Shelter Grievance Advisory Committee
Purpose: Receives denial of service complaints from shelter residents and recommends to HSH a response to such complaints.
City Affiliation: Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing (HSH)

Name: Shelter Monitoring Committee
Purpose: Documents conditions of shelters and resource centers to improve the health, safety, and treatment of residents, clients, and staff.
City Affiliation: Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing (HSH)

Name: Citywide Affordable Housing Loan Committee
Purpose: Reviews proposed project funding evaluations in order to vote on allocating funding for affordable housing development.
City Affiliation: Mayor's Office of Housing and Community Development (MOHCD)

Name: Housing Stability Fund Oversight Board
Purpose: Advises the Mayor's Office of Housing & Community Development (MOHCD) on the use of the Housing Stability Fund.
City Affiliation: Mayor's Office of Housing and Community Development (MOHCD)

Name: Inclusionary Housing Technical Advisory Committee
Purpose: Advises City Controller on the triennial Economic Feasibility Analysis of the city's inclusionary and affordable housing obligations as set forth in the Planning Code.

Name: Advisory Council to the Disability and Aging Services Commission
Purpose: Advises the Disability and Aging Services (DAS) Commission on specific needs of older adults and adults with disabilities.
City Affiliation: Department of Disability and Aging Services (DAS)

Name: Age & Disability Friendly SF Implementation Workgroup
Purpose: Oversees implementation of the Age & Disability Friendly Action Plan, a long-range and collaborative initiative to incorporate an age- and disability-friendly lens to all San Francisco policies, programs, and priorities.

Name: Child Care Planning and Advisory Council
Purpose: Creates and drives the child care and early education agenda to meet the needs of children birth to age 12 and their families in San Francisco.
City Affiliation: Children and Families Commission (Department of Early Childhood)

Name: Children, Youth and Their Families Oversight and Advisory Committee
Purpose: Participates in the administration of the Children and Youth Fund.
City Affiliation: San Francisco Department of Children, Youth and their Families (DCYF)

Name: Dignity Fund Oversight and Advisory Committee
Purpose: Participates in administering the Dignity Fund, which helps seniors and adults with disabilities secure necessary services to age in their own homes and communities.
Appointed By: Mayor***, DAS Commission and associated boards
City Affiliation: Department of Disability and Aging Services (DAS)

Name: Early Childhood Community Oversight and Advisory Committee
Purpose: Advises the Department of Early Childhood on providing early care and education for children five years old and younger.
City Affiliation: San Francisco Department of Early Childhood

Name: In-Home Supportive Services Public Authority
Purpose: Assists in finding personnel to deliver IHSS services, which maximize the potential of older adults and people with disabilities to live independently.

Name: Long Term Care Coordinating Council
Purpose: Advises the Mayor and city on policy, planning, and service delivery issues for older adults and people with disabilities.
City Affiliation: Department of Disability and Aging Services (DAS)

Name: Mayor's Disability Council
Purpose: Recommends policies to improve coordination of care within different settings (home-based, community-based, and institutional care) and service sectors (health, supportive services, housing).

Name: Service Provider Working Group
Purpose: Advises the Oversight and Advisory Committee of the Department of Children, Youth and Their Families on funding priorities, policy development, and other concerns related to the Children and Youth Fund.
Appointed By: Children, Youth, and Their Families Oversight and Advisory Committee
City Affiliation: San Francisco Department of Children, Youth and their Families (DCYF)

Name: Veterans' Affairs Commission
Purpose: Holds hearings and submits recommendations to the Board of Supervisors and the Mayor regarding the needs and concerns of veterans.

Name: Park, Recreation, and Open Space Advisory Committee
Purpose: Acts as a liaison between the Recreation and Park Commission and the residents, neighborhood groups, and organizations dedicated to park and recreational issues in their districts.
City Affiliation: San Francisco Recreation and Park Department

Name: Capital Planning Committee
Purpose: Reviews the proposed capital expenditure plan and monitors the city's ongoing compliance with the final adopted capital plan.
Appointed By: BoS, City Admin, Mayor, Controller, Planning, other depts
City Affiliation: Office of Resilience and Capital Planning (ORCP)

Name: Code Advisory Committee
Purpose: Advises the Building Inspection Commission on building codes, related rules and regulations, and proposed ordinances that may affect construction permits.

Name: Permit Prioritization Task Force
Purpose: Recommends list of prioritized permits and project types, reviews existing permit prioritization guidelines, and recommends appropriate modifications.
Appointed By: DBI, Planning, DPW, BoS, Permit Center

Name: Structural Advisory Committee
Purpose: Provides independent expert review to the Director of Building Inspection on the design and construction of buildings with special features or special design procedures.

Name: Behavioral Health Commission
Purpose: Advises the Board of Supervisors, Health Commission, and Department of Public Health as to how the City's mental health services are administered and provided.

Name: Food Security Task Force
Purpose: Recommends legislative action and city-wide strategies to increase participation in federally funded food programs.
Appointed By: BoS, DAS, DPH, HSA, HSH, other city depts.

Name: Mental Health SF Implementation Working Group
Purpose: Advises the Department of Public Health, and many other health entities on the implementation of Mental Health SF, which provides mental health services and substance abuse treatment to people who are homeless, uninsured, or enrolled in Medi-Cal or Healthy San Francisco.

Name: Sugary Drinks Distributor Tax Advisory Committee
Purpose: Makes recommendations on the effectiveness of the Sugary Drinks Distributor Tax.

Name: Disaster Council
Purpose: Develops plans for disaster response requiring the mobilization of public and private resources, and advises the Board of Supervisors on regulations needed to implement these plans.

Name: Graffiti Advisory Board
Purpose: Advises the Board of Supervisors and the Mayor on issues relating to the prevention and abatement of graffiti in the city.
Appointed By: BoS, Mayor, DPW, SFPD, Director of Cultural Affairs

Name: LGBTQI+ Advisory Committee
Purpose: Advises the Human Rights Commission on discrimination against and other issues affecting the queer community.

Name: Immigrant Rights Commission
Purpose: Guides the Mayor and Board of Supervisors on issues and policies that affect immigrants who live or work in the city.
City Affiliation: Office of Civic Engagement and Immigrant Affairs

Name: Sweatfree Procurement Advisory Group
Purpose: Evaluates the implementation, administration, and enforcement of the city's Sweatfree Contracting Ordinance, which requires city contractors and subcontractors to abide by minimum wage and labor standards as required by the Office of Labor Standards Enforcement.

Name: Bicycle Advisory Committee
Purpose: Advises the SFMTA, Board of Supervisors, and other city agencies on how to make bicycling safer and more accessible.
City Affiliation: SFMTA, SF County Transportation Authority, BoS

Name: Mission Bay Transportation Improvement Fund Advisory Committee
Purpose: Advises city departments regarding allocation of monies in the Mission Bay Transportation Improvement Fund.

Name: Municipal Transportation Agency Citizens' Advisory Council
Purpose: Provides recommendations to the Municipal Transportation Agency regarding any matter within the jurisdiction of the Agency

Name: Paratransit Coordinating Council
Purpose: Advises the SFMTA and MTA Board of Directors on issues that pertain to the SFMTA's paratransit program.

Name: Public Utilities Citizens' Advisory Committee
Purpose: Provides recommendations for the PUC's long-term strategic, financial, and capital improvement plans.

Name: Public Utilities Rate Fairness Board
Purpose: Reviews and advises the PUC on water, power, and sewer rate matters.

Name: Public Utilities Revenue Bond Oversight Committee
Purpose: Oversees the city's use of utility revenue-bond funds.
Appointed By: Mayor, BoS, Controller, Bay Area Water Users Association

Name: Juvenile Justice Coordinating Council
Purpose: As mandated by state law to be eligible for certain funding, develops and implements a continuum of responses to juvenile crime and updates the Multi-Agency Local Action Plan to serve youth in the juvenile justice system.

Name: Youth Commission
Purpose: Advises the Board of Supervisors and the Mayor on the effects of legislative policies, needs assessments, priorities, programs, and budgets concerning the children and youth of the city.
